catalog.name: National Datasets
catalog.description:
The Space Data Catalogue consists of the following data layers:

Layer NameCategoryType
Provincial BoundariesBoundariesVector
Regional BoundariesBoundariesVector
UTFVI for NCRClimateRaster
Ship MonitoringMonitoringVector

For inquiries and comments on the Space Data Catalogue, you may contact sdmad@philsa.gov.ph.

members.name: December 2023 Palawan Drought
members.description:
TYPECombined Drought Index
DATA PRODUCTSIndex Maps
TITLECombined Drought Index (CDI) 
ABSTRACTMaps processed by Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA). The datasets used were GPM rainfall, MODIS NDVI, and MODIS LST. The datasets are processed in Python with machine learning to forecast Combined Drought Index Maps. The maps were processed monthly from December 2023 to April 2024
PURPOSEThe Combined Drought Index is a monitoring index to provide insights to the severity, location, timing and duration of drought over a region.
TEMPORAL START AND END DATE01/12/2023 - 31/12/2023
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSPalawan
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTA combination of GPM Rainfall, MODIS NDVI, and MODIS LST used machine learning-based forecasting in Python. The Drought Index is displayed at a 500m spatial resolution.
CATEGORYEnvironment
KEYWORDSDrought, NDVI, LST, MODIS, GPM
EDITION1/12/2023
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)

members.name: March 06, 2024 Land Surface Temperature (LST)
members.description:
TYPEMarch 06, 2024 LST
DATA PRODUCTSMarch 06, 2024 LST Map
TITLEMarch 06, 2024 LST
ABSTRACTMaps processed by Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA). Data is in Universal Transverse Mercator, Zone 51 N. 
PURPOSEThe Land Surface Temperature (LST) map of National Capital Region (NCR) shows how “hot” the particular surface would feel to the touch. It also reveals the hot and cold spots of the region during daytime of March 06, 2024.
 
LST plays a key role to better understand the changing Earth climate system because it can provide a coherent picture of how the LST affects the Earth’s ecosystem. Knowing the past and current state of LST and exploring the reasons for the changes have great importance on strengthening disaster monitoring and early warning, agricultural production planning, climate change mitigation, etc.
 
Please note that the map is yet to be validated with ground data.
TEMPORAL START AND END DATEMarch 06, 2024
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSNational Capital Region
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTClassification
KEYWORDSNCR, Landsat
CATEGORYClimate
EDITION3/6/2024
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)

members.name: 2022 Flood Occurence
members.description:
TYPEFlood Impact
DATA PRODUCTS2022 Flood Frequency Map
TITLEFlood Frequency
ABSTRACTMaps processed by Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA). Data is in Universal Transverse Mercator, Zone 51 N. 
PURPOSEThe purpose of this map classification is to provide essential insights into the frequency of floods, crucial for effective planning, management, and monitoring of flood data nationwide. Derived from Sentinel-1 imagery at a spatial resolution of 15 meters, the dataset covers the period from January to December 2022.
TEMPORAL START AND END DATE01/01/22 - 12/31/22
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSNationwide
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTProduction note for 2022 Flood Frequency Map

The Sentinel-1 imagery utilized in this study underwent machine learning-based classification. Initially, a collection of Sentinel-1 images was pre-processed and composited into a single-year dataset. Subsequently, this dataset was classified to derive the annual frequency of floods in the Philippines.
KEYWORDSflood impact, flood frequency, flood, Sentinel-1, disaster
CATEGORYDisaster Risk Reduction and Management
EDITION8/5/2024
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)

members.name: 2022 National Land Cover
members.description:
ABSTRACTData are processed using Random Forest Algorithms to generate land cover map. Data is in Universal Transverse Mercator, Zone 51 N. 
PURPOSESummary of the intentions with which the resource(s) was developed LULC shows the classification of surface cover on the ground. This plays a significant role in planning, management, and monitoring programs. This was derived from sentinel and landsat imagery in 2022. 
TEMPORAL START AND END DATE01/01/22 - 12/31/22
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSNationwide
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTThe Sentinel and Landsat imagery was classified using Random Forest Algorithms
KEYWORDSlandcover, Random Forest, Landsat 8, Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2
CATEGORYLand Cover and Land Use
EDITION8/5/2024
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)

members.name: Building Density for NCR
members.description:
TYPEBuilding Density
DATA PRODUCTSBuilding Density Map
TITLEBuilding Density
ABSTRACTMaps processed by Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA). Data are processed by a criteria of total buildings per 500 m to generate a building density map. Data is in Universal Transverse Mercator, Zone 51 N. 
PURPOSESummary of the intentions with which the resource(s) was developed LULC shows the building density for the specified region. This shall play a significant role in planning, management, and monitoring programs at the National Capital Region. The output has a spatial resolution of 500 m.
TEMPORAL START AND END DATE2023
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSNational Capital Region (Metro Manila)
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTThe generated data utilizes the sum of the building count (total buildings) per 500 m
KEYWORDSPhilSA, landcover, buildings, National Capital Region
CATEGORYLand Cover and Land Use
EDITION8/5/2024
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)

members.name: 2023 Mangrove Extents
members.description:
TYPEMangroves
DATA PRODUCTSMangrove Extent Map
TITLE2023 Mangrove Extent
ABSTRACTMaps processed by Philippine Space Agency (PhilSA). Data are processed using Random Forest to generate the mangrove extent map. Data is in Universal Transverse Mercator, Zone 51 N. 
PURPOSESummary of the intentions with which the resource(s) was developed LULC shows the mangrove extent cover on the ground. This plays a significant role in planning, management, and monitoring programs in the Philippines. This is derived from a 10-m satellite data (2023).
TEMPORAL START AND END DATEJan 2023 - Dec 2023
SPATIAL REPRESENTATION TYPERaster, GeoTIFF
REGIONSNationwide
DATA QUALITY STATEMENTClassification
KEYWORDSMangroves, SRTM, PALSAR-2, Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Philippines
CATEGORYVegetation
EDITION8/5/2024
LICENSEThe use of the datasets provided herewith are covered by End Users License Agreement (EULA)
